title: In game Voice Comms.
body:
I don't feel like voice comms is hard to implement. (Knows nothing about computers). For a game the requires so much teamwork why is it not standard issue. 

It's a High flaming game, what game isn't that requires teamwork.

It would be great to communicate without wasting time typing or my team mates wasting time typing.

It's almost been a decade...

Only reason that I can see as negative to it is.

1. Easier to flame. (have a mute button)
2. League has worked without it all this time. (Has it?) Imagine the potential and the increase in team ability and ability to teach people better ways to play.
3. I realize I'm playing with four 15 year olds and I feel old.


COMMMM     ONNNNNNN

That's completely fine, but League is well and truly a **team** game and some people would prefer to have as much communication as possible in order to have the best teamwork. Sure you can just use pings but can't we just step it a little? Those who don't want it can just turn off voice chat and go ahead as normal, that way I don't see any issues.

Why don't those who want voice chat go ahead and use any of the voice chat systems available to them?
Why would Riot implement something like that, unless it was a feature you had to pay for?

Because it's hard when you playing with randoms to get people together like that and especially if not everyone has the same program, its just easier if the voice chat is built-in. CSGO and Overwatch players put up with it and it works fine.

Why the hell would anyone want voice comms in the most toxic game anyone has ever come across? Honestly, can you imagine it? Wholy shit! No thank you very much. Muting people but still having to deal with their noob ping spam is enough for me let alone being forced to mute every retarded monkey every game.

If you can't listen to other people's pings or look at your minimap there is something else wrong other than no voice comms. That's just understanding the basics of the game.

I think you're taking this too much into the ranked perspective, because yes we all do become a little more triggered when our precious LP is at stake. League does well indeed have a VERY toxic community, which is why we are taking steps to try and improve it, so why don't we just test this out and see? Maybe it could make people rage more, or maybe it could improve teamwork and make people less likely to get triggered? We can't really decide until Riot actually attempts it.

Yes definitely, I actually have a very long paragraph explaining why but I'll cover the basic overview.

The most powerful argument against having voice chat is: "It'll only make League more toxic", but lets look at it in more depth. Ask yourself "What is the biggest reason for toxicity in League?" Usually it's because that one guy ran straight into a 1v5, or because someone wasn't looking at the minimap and got 3 man ganked. Basically a lot of the flame comes off of people getting angry at other people failing. (With the rest coming usually from cross-team chat about "That one champ that's op and broken"). So now think about what could help people from failing & flaming less? Maybe if there was a better way of communicating to your team then maybe people wouldn't be making stupid mistakes so often? And I can tell you a good amount of people would definitely rather speak a sentence then stand there and quickly type it out in chat (How many times have you suddenly stopped to type in chat then immediately jumped on?). And even if there is that one kid who just likes to abuse voice and scream whenever he dies, there is always the trusty **MUTE** button, just like every other game....

although you then have the issue with people who don't know how to use voicecomms properly and with everyone talking at the same time. Sure some people will get used to it, but others won't learn this and some games will be awfully chaotic. When I first started playing league with friends over discord or skype, I was very bad at managing the important information over the voice channel when teamfights erupted.
Yeah its probably just you, every time I've been on discord with people everything works out fine and I usually put in my discord link in chat every game to encourage people to get on.

haha being able to use voice comms does take some getting used to for some people though. I've gotten the hang of it now; but I'm just saying I'd imagine there would be alot of players who may be bad at using them, or might refuse to learn the correct way to use it.
You said what I was thinking. ;)

Tencent controls riot, and the chinese League server has in game comms (as well as other things we don't).

Tencent is also a chinese company.
i like voice coms, it makes eating chips fun.
